text: hi everyone I'm Lindsay strand and today
on sweet talk I'm making sour cherry
pistachio crisps sour cherries are such
a special summer fruit and I can't think
of a better way to show them off than to
top them with a simple pistachio crumble
so here I have one in 3/4 pound of sour
cherries these were frozen thawed if you
can find them fresh get them they're
worth it they're so fleeting in the
summer time if it's not summer or you
can't find them at your market you can
get them frozen online sometimes in the
freezer section so these have been
thawed and then drained a little bit I
split a little bit of the juices but I
pour it off most of them and now I'm
going to start on my crumble so starting
with the dry ingredients have half a cup
plus 2 tablespoons of all-purpose flour
1/2 a cup of chopped unsalted pistachios
and 1/3 of a cup of rolled oats this
gives it that nice 2 quarter teaspoon of
baking powder and a quarter teaspoon of
kosher salt to give this a whisk just to
combine the green color will look so
pretty with the red cherries all right
and now moving on to my butter I have 6
tablespoons of room-temperature butter
and I'm adding 3 tablespoons of light
brown sugar going to mix this on medium
until it's light and fluffy
so now I'll add my dry ingredients into
here and mix it on low just until clump
start forming
for my cherry filling I have these
beautiful cherries here this is one of
the quarters pounds of sour cherries
that are pitted and thawed two teaspoons
of cornstarch this is our thickener to
thicken the juices just a little pinch
of cinnamon I'm not gonna use all of
this this is one of those ingredients
that works really well with cherry kind
of a warming spice that brings out all
of those beautiful sweet and sour
flavors and half a cup of granulated
sugar actually and now that I'm using
the sugar I realized I forgot it in my
topping so I'm just going to add a
quarter cup of granulated sugar and mix
until combined
I'll stir this together Bernie tell
these are so juicy I love that bright
red color so that's it so simple I'm
just going to pour these into my baking
dish I love that this dessert is so
simple because you can really let the
flavor of these special berries shine on
top here's a little fun piece of trivia
do you guys know the difference between
a crisp and a crumble let us know in the
comments just kidding I'll tell you
right now so a crumble is a mix of
butter sugar and flour which is like a
streusel topping and then a crisp
generally has nuts or oats out of it so
this is technically a crisp but no
matter what you name it I'm sure your
guests full of it
we've scatter this over in kind of a
range of size clumps the little ones
will soak into the juice and the big
ones will crisp up at the oven those
guys ready to go in the oven it's going
in for 50 minutes at 375 degrees until
it's bubbling all the way around
so I pulled my crisp out of the oven I
let it cool for an hour that's the hard
part but you really need to let it cool
so that the cornstarch can work its
magic on those juices but it doesn't run
everywhere when you go to serve it this
is a great make-ahead dessert you can
always serve it a little warm if you
want to by popping it back in the oven
and you guys saw how easy that was so
just make your fruit base and the simple
topping pop it in the oven and you're
ready to eat a delicious berry crisp but
of course you gotta serve it with ice
cream right right on the side oh man
this looks good
you saw how easy that was I hope this
got you inspired to get in the kitchen
and bake you can make this with any
barrier fruit you want but if you see
sour cherries you've gotta try this one
let me know in the comments
Wow the cinnamon and nuts the sour
cherries this one's a winner if you're
enjoying this video and be sure to place
subscribe we have so many great fun
